response:
MRI is essential to confirm demyelination and demonstrate dissemination in space and time. Bloods and CSF are required to rule out mimics (infection, autoimmune) and detect oligoclonal bands or specific antibodies (AQP4, MOG) that alter long-term management.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Spinal Cord with contrast", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Thyroid function tests", "Vitamin B12 and Folate", "Anti-nuclear antibody (ANA)", "Anti-AQP4 antibodies", "Anti-MOG antibodies", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology", "Lumbar Puncture (CSF analysis for oligoclonal bands, protein, glucose, cell count, culture)", "Visual Evoked Potentials"]
